p: C. sinensis is a rich source of vitamin C, a natural antioxidant that support the immune system activity [ 33, 34]. C. sinensis has been used traditionally, to treat intestinal disorders (such as cramps, constipation, colic, and diarrhea), respiratory disorders (such as cough, cold, bronchitis, and tuberculosis), obesity, menstrual disorder, cardiovascular disease (angina, hypertension), anxiety, depression, and stress [ 35].
